name: ABORDO, Peter
bio: ABOUT THE ARTIST Peter Abordo (b. May 8, 1971, Sampaloc, Manila) is a Filipino painter whose works transform ordinary daily activities into compelling visual narratives. He studied Fine Arts at the University of Santo Tomas under the mentorship of respected professors such as Tam Austria, Mario Santiago, and Butch Soriano. After graduating, he worked in advertising and animation studios, where his background in animation honed his eye for detail and observation—skills that became central to his art. Abordo’s paintings capture the poetry in everyday life, rendered with a sensitivity that elevates the familiar into stories that speak far beyond the canvas.
description: ABOUT THE ARTIST Peter Abordo (b. May 8, 1971, Sampaloc, Manila) is a Filipino painter whose works transform ordinary daily activities into compelling visual narratives. Abordo’s paintings capture the poetry in everyday life, rendered with a sensitivity that elevates the familiar into stories that speak far beyond the canvas.

name: ACUNA, Ivan
bio: Ivan was Born in Manila, August 23, 1968. He studied Fine Artist the University of The Philippines and attended art workshops in Brisbane, Australia. His artistic interest come forth through looking it the works of Jose Joya. Other major influences were Willem De Kooning and Joan Miro. Ivan started as a professional photographer before becoming one of the most recognizable Philippine contemporary artist. He is a non-traditional artist who prefers to collaborate with the vision of interior designers.

name: ALEGRE, Hermes
bio: ABOUT THE ARTIST Born in 1968 in Daet, Camarines Norte, Hermes Alegre is a Multi-awarded artist. He graduated from the Philippine Women's University, Majoring in Fine Arts, where he studied under notable artists Ibarra dela Rosa and Mars Galang.
description: ABOUT THE ARTIST Born in 1968 in Daet, Camarines Norte, Hermes Alegre is a Multi-awarded artist. He graduated from the Philippine Women's University, Majoring in Fine Arts, where he studied under notable artists Ibarra dela Rosa and Mars Galang.

name: ANGELES, Isab
bio: Isab Angeles, a self-taught artist and jack of all trades, hails from a family steeped in diverse artistic disciplines including literary arts, music, and photography. Embracing a gypsy spirit, Isab has never shied away from learning anything necessary to thrive. Her journey into the art world began as an art consultant, where she immersed herself in the creative processes of other artists, gaining insight into their techniques and disciplines.
description:
Isab Angeles, a self-taught artist and jack of all trades, hails from a family steeped in diverse artistic disciplines including literary arts, music, and photography. Embracing a gypsy spirit, Isab has never shied away from learning anything necessary to thrive. Her journey into the art world began as an art consultant, where she immersed herself in the creative processes of other artists, gaining insight into their techniques and disciplines.

Through her art, Isab discovered her true self-worth, proving that a person can reinvent and discover herself at any age. Her work reflects her relentless pursuit of personal growth, with each piece representing a step towards being a better person than she was yesterday. Her use of tranquil colors and meditative landscapes aims to inspire and provide a sense of peace to her viewers. Through her art, Isab seeks not only to express her inner journey but also to offer a soothing escape and a moment of tranquility to all who engage with her work.

name: Antonio, Marcel
bio: Marcel Antonio (b. June 28, 1965, Manila, Philippines) is a Filipino painter celebrated for his figurative and narrative style that blends myth, memory, and modern life. Born to artists Angelito Antonio and Norma Belleza, Antonio developed a distinct visual language marked by dreamlike, dramatic scenes with undertones of melancholy, sensuality, and existential reflection. Often described as magic realist or pseudo-narrative, his works invite open interpretation, challenging viewers to find meaning beyond the obvious story. By repurposing elements from art history and popular imagery, Antonio embraces borrowing and quotation as creative tools, producing paintings that are at once familiar and enigmatic. A prolific artist, he has exhibited extensively in the Philippines and abroad, cementing his place as one of the country’s most sought-after contemporary painters.
description: Marcel Antonio (b. June 28, 1965, Manila, Philippines) is a Filipino painter celebrated for his figurative and narrative style that blends myth, memory, and modern life. name: BADAJOS, Nilo
bio: Trained in classical figurative tradition. Nilo Badajos appears to conform to the rules set his precedents. But he is by no means a slave to it; throughout his art career, he has challenged his style and reinvented his craft, developing his own technique or painting the human figure, as well as mastering and nuanced interplay of light and shadow in his works.
description:
Trained in classical figurative tradition. Nilo Badajos appears to conform to the rules set his precedents. But he is by no means a slave to it; throughout his art career, he has challenged his style and reinvented his craft, developing his own technique or painting the human figure, as well as mastering and nuanced interplay of light and shadow in his works.

Trained in classical figurative tradition, Nilo Badajos appears to conform to the rules set by his precedents. But he is by no means a slave to it; throughout his art career, he has challenged his style and reinvented his craft, developing his own technique of painting the human figure, as well as mastering the nuanced interplay of light and shadow in his works.

name: BAGACINA, Jefferson “Love”
bio: ABOUT THE ARTIST Jefferson Bañez Bagacina, popularly known as Love Bagacina, is a Filipino painter born on October 12, 1993, in Paete, Laguna, the Carving Capital of the Philippines. Love's artistic journey began by creating his own style of houses with a touch of the much-treasured Filipino lifestyle. He developed his works using whimsical patterns of houses with a splash of vibrant colors, making his every masterpiece bright and alive. Love's paintings portray the simple Filipino lifestyles that he experienced as a child, such as children playing traditional Filipino games, a father selling dirty ice creams, a mother burning dried leaves, a brother carrying containers filled with water, and a group of women talking about each other's lives. These lifestyles are his spark of joy as a child who grew up in the province. Love's artworks gained recognition and awards, including his recognition as "Natatanging Alagad ng Sining sa Bayan ng Paete, Laguna." Love's journey as an artist continues to inspire and touch the hearts of many people.

name: BALDEMOR, Angelo
bio: Lito was born on August 2, 1955 in Paete, Laguna. He took up Fine Arts in FEATI, under Ibarra de la Rosa. His widely appreciated for his own art form, “PAINTURES”, a brilliant three-dimensional rendition of otherwise two- dimensional paintings. His rare combination of paintings and sculptures, brilliantly executed with carved realistic details easily caught the attention of art collectors and fellow artists.

His rare combination of paintings and sculptures, brilliantly executed with carved realistic details easily caught the attention of art collectors and fellow artists.

name: BANDALAN, Al
bio: Al Bandalan (b. 1955, Baybay, Leyte) is a Filipino painter known for his evocative floral and garden-inspired works. His canvases often depict lush blooms and natural forms, rendered without human figures, creating a sense of mystery and timeless beauty. Bandalan’s paintings are celebrated for their delicate play of light, fragrance-like quality, and dreamlike atmosphere.
description: Al Bandalan (b. 1955, Baybay, Leyte) is a Filipino painter known for his evocative floral and garden-inspired works. His canvases often depict lush blooms and natural forms, rendered without human figures, creating a sense of mystery and timeless beauty. Bandalan’s paintings are celebrated for their delicate play of light, fragrance-like quality, and dreamlike atmosphere.

name: BANEZ, Joseph
bio: Joseph or “Otep” as he is known was born and raised in Paete,Laguna. Folksy as his artworks may seem, he is able to portray humor with subjects and scenes depicting daily episodes in provincial comic life. Greatly influenced by Norman Rockwell and our very own celebrated Filipino cartoonist, Larry Alcala, Otep’s detailed renditions combined with playful colors and hilarious settings, merits his art career as he is currently one of the most sought-after POP SOCIAL REALIST in the Philippines’ contemporary art scene.

name: BENITO, Jovan
bio: A native of Pakil, Laguna, Jovan Benito is a self-taught painter who first forayed into professional art in 2007. Married to Filipiniana surrealist Jerry Morada, she started as an apprentice to her husband. Benito has participated in various local and international exhibits. Jovan signature style is renderings of everyday scenes of colorful, lively women in rural areas but interpreted in an unmistakable contemporary style.

name: BEQUILLO, Jason
bio: Jason Bequillo (b. 1977) is a contemporary Filipino painter known for his realistic oil paintings that incorporate pop culture imagery to depict everyday life and themes of Filipino culture. Despite physical challenges, Bequillo has established himself as a portrait artist, exploring various mediums like charcoal, watercolor, and pastels before moving into oil painting. He is recognized for blending realism with contemporary influences, making his work relatable and engaging for viewers.
description: Jason Bequillo (b. 1977) is a contemporary Filipino painter known for his realistic oil paintings that incorporate pop culture imagery to depict everyday life and themes of Filipino culture. He is recognized for blending realism with contemporary influences, making his work relatable and engaging for viewers.

name: BERNARDINO, Danna
bio: Danna Bernardino, a Linguistics graduate from the University of the Philippines, traces her artistic journey back to her mother’s influence when, as a child, she sought to learn the art of drawing. Beginning with sketches, her talent blossomed into vibrant paintings, exploring a variety of mediums such as pastels, acrylic, and watercolors, with some of her early works even finding their way into teen magazines. Embracing the rise of technology, Danna ventured into digital art, blending tradition with innovation. Two years ago, she embarked on a sculpting journey, seeking a more dimensional, tangible, and tactile medium. What started as a hobby fueled by curiosity has now evolved into a profound and enduring passion.

What started as a hobby fueled by curiosity has now evolved into a profound and enduring passion.

name: BERNARDO, Jacob
bio: Jacob Bernardo (b. February 3, 1979, Quezon City) is a storyteller who brings imagined worlds to life through intricately crafted dioramas made mostly from everyday found objects. Drawing inspiration from history, folklore, literature, film, illustration, and the worlds of DC and Marvel comics, his works create miniature universes where fantasy and reality collide. Each scene is a boundless loop of narratives—Superman encountering a manananggal, The Mandalorian in pursuit, or eerie dolls lurking in Manila’s shanty towns—blurring time, place, and dimension. Through these meticulously constructed boxes, Bernardo invites viewers to explore, wonder, and lose themselves in realms where entertainment meets awe, and where the absurdity of life can be both contemplated and, if only in miniature, controlled.

name: CAGANDAHAN, Glen
bio: Glenn Cagandahan is a sculptor of folk imagery and subjects known for his use of different mediums, shifting from traditional materials like wood, metal, stone, terracotta, glass to modern materials like resin, fiberglass, plastics and ready-mades. Trained at the College of Fine Arts of the University of the Philippines, Cagandahan’s work seeks to establish a unique cultural identity through his art, expressing folk life and simulating the Philippine rural scene.
description:
Glenn Cagandahan is a sculptor of folk imagery and subjects known for his use of different mediums, shifting from traditional materials like wood, metal, stone, terracotta, glass to modern materials like resin, fiberglass, plastics and ready-mades. Trained at the College of Fine Arts of the University of the Philippines, Cagandahan’s work seeks to establish a unique cultural identity through his art, expressing folk life and simulating the Philippine rural scene.

A product of University of the Philippines College of Fine Arts majoring in Sculpture, Glenn Cagandahan is consistent winner in the national art competition Art Association of the Philippines from 2004 to 2007, winning Second Prize 2006 in Sculpture Category. In May of 2008 he was internationally auctioned at Borobudur Auction House for his sculpture ‘Best friends’ and was successfully sold. He is currently teaching Humanities 2 at the University of the Philippines Los Baños. Glenn aims “to improve and mobilize the present level of production in sculpture making” in order to enrich Philippine Sculpture as an entire heritage complete with its own cultural identification.

The present works showcase Cagandahan’s drive to assimilate new methods and materials into the heart of Philippine Sculpture. The sculptor answers the call of changing times and technologies, signaling the shift from traditional sculpture materials like wood, metal, stone, terra-cotta, glass, to modern materials like resin, fiberglass, plastics, and ready-mades. His studied technique informs the expressionist use of epoxy clay generously endowed upon steel armatures. Old matter sloughs off to proceed to the new.

Meanwhile, old themes grow in complication and expressive force – for Cagandahan likewise projects upon Philippine Sculpture various innovations of form. The dreamy melt of Dali’s paint and the severe attenuations of Giacometti’s structures find voluptuous convergence in the folksy proportions of his earth spirits, guitar players, and carabao riders. These current results linger in the eye with eerie yet genial stillness. Unfamiliar shapes greet us, but we are brought back home.

name: CAINTO, Caroline
bio: Born on November 20, 1979, her husband, Ronnel Cainto mentored her in the path of being an artist. Known for abstractions of flora and fauna, Caroline Cainto has a flair
description:
Born on November 20, 1979, her husband, Ronnel Cainto mentored her in the path of being an artist. Known for abstractions of flora and fauna, Caroline Cainto has a flair

for turning landscapes into something lyrical and expressive. Her paintings are deceptively simple yet highly sophisticated

essays in harmonious composition where color takes precedence over drawing.

name: CAINTO, Ronnel
bio: Ronnel Cainto’s background hails from a proud heritage of renowned wood carvers in Paete, Laguna. Born on May 28,
description:
Ronnel Cainto’s background hails from a proud heritage of renowned wood carvers in Paete, Laguna. Born on May 28,

1978, he began as an assistant to his father, who sculpted religious puon as the primary source of the family’s income.

His work is heavily influenced by Mexican aesthetics and a throwback to his childhood favorite, Gumby. Ronnel maintains

a tone of simplicity in his creations through limited but bold colour palettes.

name: CARLOS, Isagani Punzalan
bio: Isagani Carlos is a contemporary Filipino painter known for his refined command of oil on canvas, where he weaves expressive forms, layered textures, and evocative moods into compelling compositions. His works, ranging from intimate portraits to large-scale pieces, reveal a balance of technical finesse and emotional depth, often highlighting the elegance of human form and the richness of natural motifs. Through his paintings, Carlos creates a dialogue between realism and abstraction, inviting viewers into an experience that is both personal and universal.

Through his paintings, Carlos creates a dialogue between realism and abstraction, inviting viewers into an experience that is both personal and universal.

name: CASTRILLO, Ronald
bio: Ronald was born on June 3, 1964. His parents, Aurea and Amado Castrillo - a great writer, illustrator and sculptor has influenced and inspired him to develop his interest and skills in the arts at a tender age. With a degree in Bachelor of Science in Aeronautical Engineering, Major in Aircraft Design in PATTS School of Auronautics, Ronald perfectly combines his artistic process and technical knowledge to create unrivaled sculptures and pieces of art, making him one of the premier sculptors of his generation.

name: CONMIGO, Reymar
bio: Reymar Conmigo was born on October 30, 1967, in Parañaque. At a young age, he started participating in various competitions in the field of art. He previously worked at an Auto Repair Shop as a Service Manager until he met Hermes Alegre and Loreto Racuya who encourage him to return to the arts. Conmigo’s cubist works give a stylistic edge to his pieces, with carefully defined composition where his leaves motif varies in color and pattern. His work is an exploration of the sheer majesty of nature, a rare spectable captured and immortalized on canvas.

His work is an exploration of the sheer majesty of nature, a rare spectable captured and immortalized on canvas.

name: CUNANAN, Lemuel
bio: Born on August 27, 1974, Lemuel Cunanan is a self-taught airbrush artist designer as well as painter who specializes in oil and acrylic. An avid participant of art contests in the country, Lemuel has won some of the most prestigious competitions locally. Cunanan’s style focuses on classical realism with elements of fantasy and cultural influences from the Philippines. His paintings exhibit a highly developed sense of colour, composition, scale, and surface, most often through the use of subtly subdued tones and complex compositions.RE ABOUT THE ARTIST

His paintings exhibit a highly developed sense of colour, composition, scale, and surface, most often through the use of subtly subdued tones and complex compositions.RE ABOUT THE ARTIST

name: DELOLA, Angelo
bio: Angelo M. Delola (b. October 29, 1972, Murphy, Cubao, Quezon City) is a Filipino visual artist and sculptor who earned his Fine Arts degree, major in Advertising, from Far Eastern University in 1993. After years working as a full-time graphics artist—including his last post at Viva Entertainment—and writing unpublished novels and vlogging as “KIDLAP,” he shifted entirely to art during the pandemic in 2022, quickly becoming active in exhibitions across Metro Manila and beyond. Delola is known for pioneering “scrapture,” a sculptural method that transforms discarded objects—broken toys, mechanical fragments, and obsolete electronics—into meticulously finished works that evoke ancient metal artifacts. His aesthetic merges steampunk machinery, Art Nouveau curves, and speculative organic forms, creating hybrid figures and structures that appear like relics from an alternate world. Guided by his belief that art is shaped by Consciousness rather than the artist alone, Delola views himself as a vessel through which creation moves, grounding a practice where the forgotten becomes permanent and the disposable becomes meaningful.
description: Angelo M. Delola (b. name: DELOS SANTOS, Roland
bio: Born in 1952 in Tanay Rolando Delos Santos is a still life artist whose passion for art ignited during his elementary years. He found inspiration in the works of talented illustrators such as FC Javinal, Nestor Redondo, Angel Cacnio, Tony Carabana, Alex Nino and Larry Alcala. Spending countless hours copying their comic illustrations, this became his training and favorite pastime. From 1975 to 1980, Delos Santos studied under Ibarra de la Rosa at FEATI, and his recent works center on antique Chinese Jars and he aimed to create a series that would resemble a collection under glass. He drew inspiration from his own collection of antique jars and some references from Christie’s and Sotheby’s catalogs. His artistic journey also includes influences from artist like Tam Austria and Andrew Wyeth. He was a part of the Tanay Group that was founded in 1975 with artists such as Martin Catolos, Joni and Charley Pagalunan, Crispin Agno, Rustico Timtiman, and Nestor Villarosa. Even if the art scene changes he continues to find inspiration in Tanay’s landscapes. To him Tanay’s scenery remains a rich source of inspiration, even as the town evolves.

name: DEMATERA, Bullet
bio: Ronald “Bullet” Dematera is a Filipino self-taught hyperrealist painter renowned for his intricate fusion of realism, surrealism, and pop art. Born and raised in Bulacan, he faced early challenges, including a cleft palate and limited formal education, which led him to work from a young age. Despite these obstacles, his passion for art remained unwavering. At 20, he began working as a studio assistant, eventually apprenticing under renowned artist Ronald Ventura for nearly a decade. This mentorship honed his skills in graphite, oil, and acrylic painting, allowing him to develop a distinctive style characterized by vibrant textures and dreamlike compositions that intertwine nature, florals, humans, and animals. His works often explore the complex relationship between humanity and the natural world, conveying themes of beauty, resilience, and introspection. Dematera's art has been featured in numerous solo exhibitions, including The Unspoken Wilderness and Menagerie, and his pieces have garnered recognition in the art community. His journey from adversity to artistic acclaim serves as a testament to his resilience and dedication to his craft.

name: DIZON, Jeff
bio: Jeff Dizon (b. February 4, 1954) is a celebrated Filipino contemporary visual artist, best known for his modern expressionist works that combine highly detailed, ornate line work with richly colored figures and symbolic concepts. A graduate of the University of the Philippines and a distinguished scholar, Dizon’s talent was recognized early on by mentors, including National Artist Jose Joya. Over the decades, he has mounted numerous solo exhibitions and garnered awards that affirm his mastery and innovation in painting. His skill, techniques, and profound artistic expression have been highly praised by critics, scholars, and collectors alike, securing his place as one of the most respected figures in contemporary Philippine art.

name: DORONIO, Rico
bio: Born on February 17, 1966, in Borbon, Cebu. He studied at Makati Polytechnic Community College where he placed
description:
Born on February 17, 1966, in Borbon, Cebu. He studied at Makati Polytechnic Community College where he placed

first in the First Tubig Pangkulay art competition during his freshman year. Trained by brother-in-law Antonio Mahilum,

he assisted Mahilum in executing the mural commissioned by Allied Bank for its main office at Ayala Avenue. In 1989, Doronio joined the stable of artists under Heritage Art Center. Doronio presented his first one man show in 1997.

name: GEDUSPAN, Anthony
bio: Born on October 20, 1978 in Guimbal, Iloilo. He graduated with a Bachelor Degree of Science in Mechanical Engineering at the Western Institute of Technology. Anthony started to seriously paint at the age of 19. With no formal training, he scanned magazines “and interacted with senior artists. He took special interest in a style called cubism, adding his own flavor by experimenting his own combinations of hues and contrasts.

He took special interest in a style called cubism, adding his own flavor by experimenting his own combinations of hues and contrasts.

name: GOMEZ, Ray
bio: Ray Gomez (b. 1962, Nasugbu, Batangas) is a Filipino hyperrealist painter celebrated for his extraordinary still-life works, particularly his meticulous depictions of rice. Known for his near-photographic precision, Gomez transforms an everyday staple into a powerful symbol of Filipino identity, culture, and sustenance. His artistry lies in the painstaking detail of each grain, rendered with astonishing clarity and reverence, elevating the ordinary into the profound. Highly recognized by fellow artists and collectors, his works showcase both technical mastery and cultural depth, making him a distinctive figure in Philippine hyperrealism.

Highly recognized by fellow artists and collectors, his works showcase both technical mastery and cultural depth, making him a distinctive figure in Philippine hyperrealism.

name: Hablo, Allain
bio: Allain Hablo (b. April 1968, Estancia, Iloilo) is a Filipino abstract and mixed-media artist recognized for his textured surfaces and meditations on healing, resilience, and time. Moving from figuration to abstraction, Hablo developed a language of cracks, joins, and metallic lusters inspired by the Japanese art of kintsugi, where brokenness becomes beauty. Working with wood, canvas, and even stainless steel sheets, he manipulates materials by burning, scoring, and layering pigments, creating compositions that balance austerity with radiance. His works, often described as industrial yet spiritual, embody a quiet strength that transforms imperfection into a powerful metaphor for human endurance.

name: HIPOLITO, Dante
bio: Dante Hipolito is a hyper-realist Filipino painter whose works contain portraits of people with heartfelt smiles, the style has become his signature, marking him as “The Smile Painter.” Unafraid to experiment, he synergized all his influences and knowledge to evolve the self-developed style, a take-off from hyperrealism. For the Papal visit of the country in 2015, Hipolito was commissioned by the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of the Philippines to create a painting as a gift for the Pope wherein he featured high-profile personalities wearing farm clothes in vibrant rural realism.

name: HIPOLITO, Ella
bio: Ella Hipolito is a Filipino art director and coffee artist based in San Mateo, Rizal. She earned her degree in Fine Arts, major in Advertising, from the College of the Holy Spirit, Mendiola, Manila.
description:
Ella Hipolito is a Filipino art director and coffee artist based in San Mateo, Rizal. She earned her degree in Fine Arts, major in Advertising, from the College of the Holy Spirit, Mendiola, Manila.

A freelance artist, Hipolito’s skills span creative concept development, art direction, graphic design, and various forms of visual and manual crafts. Her passion for animals and nature often informs her artistic sensibility.

Known for her imaginative use of coffee as a medium, Hipolito creates works ranging from coffee paintings and bean mosaics to t-shirt and stone art, assemblage, and sculpture. Her art often supports charitable causes through exhibitions and personal advocacy projects.

Her work has been featured in The Philippine Star, Manila Bulletin, Mega Magazine, DDG, and various television programs including DZMM Teleradyo, GMA’s I Juander, and Net25 Landmarks.

Hipolito held her first solo exhibition, Coffee Creativity: The Many Colors and Textures of Coffee, in 2012, followed by Coffee Creativity: By Request in 2013. She continues to participate in group exhibitions and is known for introducing new and inventive concepts in each show.

name: LIAO, Ed
bio: Born May 6, 1962 in Cebu City. He studied Fine Arts major in painting at UP Cebu and fisnished his bachelor degree in UP Diliman. He started as a Realist artist influenced by his mentor Jose Blanco, later on evolved to abstract using principles of ZEN. He had 6 one-man shows and one of his current mural works are exhibited at Robinsons Cybergate.
description: Born May 6, 1962 in Cebu City. He studied Fine Arts major in painting at UP Cebu and fisnished his bachelor degree in UP Diliman. He started as a Realist artist influenced by his mentor Jose Blanco, later on evolved to abstract using principles of ZEN. He had 6 one-man shows and one of his current mural works are exhibited at Robinsons Cybergate.

name: LIM, Sven Wilbur
bio: Sven Lim (b. November 23, 1988, Iba, La Loma, Quezon City), known as “Living Pages,” is a Filipino artist who transforms discarded books into intricate sculptural works where text, form, and engineering converge. A graduate of FEU East Asia College and a former robotic arm engineer, Lim is a self-taught creator whose practice involves carving figures from dismantled pages and reattaching them onto the book to suggest words coming alive. His technical background informs the precision and durability of his pieces, which are preserved through resin and clear varnish, aiming to evoke calm and delight in both private and public spaces. His work has been showcased at the CCP Pasinaya Festival and the NCCA Arts Month 2025, and he received 2nd place in the Watson’s Re-Imagine Recycle Art Competition, with one of his sculptures included in the collection of Ryan Cayabyab.

name: MAHILUM, Anton
bio: Anton Mahilum began to paint nature inspired sceneries that depict simplicity in the rural life. Subjects he preferred were small streams and rivers where carefree children play. A sense of the cool and calm are his choice of colors, rendered in realist style. The fine evolution of the artist is greatly seen in his current works where the use of bold, iridescent colors highly contrast his subjects and themes that create a distinct style that is modern and traditional.

name: MAHILUM, Joel
bio: Joel Mahilum was born on March 18, 1974. He studied at University of the Philippines College of Fine Arts. Joel is the second son of master artist Tony Mahilum. Born in a family of artists, it was only natural that he would be interested in the arts.He started out his career by painting children with a tranquil pensive mood, instead of the energetic enigma most artists portray. With modern, stylized, textures lightly contracting the quiet and focused subject one could sense a serene mood of innocence captured on canvas.

With modern, stylized, textures lightly contracting the quiet and focused subject one could sense a serene mood of innocence captured on canvas.

name: MALLARI, Ram
bio: Ram Mallari Jr. (b. 1966, Bataan, Philippines) is a Filipino sculptor widely recognized as the country’s “Father of Steampunk Art.” Transforming discarded industrial scrap into intricate retrofuturistic works, his reclaimed sculptures explore resilience, sustainability, and the tension between past and future. With a background in architecture and drafting, Mallari rose to prominence through major exhibitions and public commissions such as The Last Tree at Ayala Nuvali and the life-size steampunk Lapu-Lapu at Camp Crame. Featured on the cover of World Sculpture News in 2015 and in global outlets like The Washington Post and BBC, he continues to push boundaries with ambitious projects including the forthcoming Fort Malasimbo Museum, envisioned to showcase his largest and most innovative works.

name: MARQUEZ, Oliver
bio: Oliver was born on April 30, 1974 in Angeles City. He was born in a family of artists that drew scales, wildlife that sold tourist art but was forced to leave for Malolos, Bulacan due to the Mt. Pinatubo incident. He wanted to study fine arts but his family could not afford it and took up drafting at the Bulacan State University. He opened a sign shop and stopped painting for 10 years. Sometime in 2011 a friend encouraged him to get back to painting and started competing in art competitions and won 3 grand prizes from PAGCOR, AAP on-the-spot contest and Gov. Ejercito’s Pagsanjan Art Competition.

Ejercito’s Pagsanjan Art Competition.

name: MARTINEZ, Raymart
bio: Raymart Martinez is a contemporary Filipino painter whose expressive acrylic compositions celebrate familial bonds, everyday moments, and festive scenes. His works, often warm and evocative, include titles such as A Gift from the Heart, Lovers Series, Mother and Child, Fruit Vendors, and Pagdiriwang Sa Gitna Ng Gintong Ani (“Celebration Amidst the Golden Harvest”) — each piece capturing the richness of Filipino life through dynamic color palettes and intimate forms.
description: Raymart Martinez is a contemporary Filipino painter whose expressive acrylic compositions celebrate familial bonds, everyday moments, and festive scenes. His works, often warm and evocative, include titles such as A Gift from the Heart, Lovers Series, Mother and Child, Fruit Vendors, and Pagdiriwang Sa Gitna Ng Gintong Ani (“Celebration Amidst the Golden Harvest”) — each piece capturing the richness of Filipino life through dynamic color palettes and intimate forms.

name: MONNAR
bio: Monnar’s art is characterized by using bright and vibrant colors in his organic and graphical paintings. His subjects and characters are drawn in an outline of distorted and exaggerated style, embellished in an array of different inking techniques. He prefers to work with Pen, Ink with Acrylic, and his earlier career as a comic creator has allowed him to easily conceptualize ideas and editorial topics and tackle different subject matters. Monnar has exhibited in several shows, including the show “Preview: Adieu!” at the Galerie Menouar in Paris, which was met with critical acclaim. He is a versatile artist who works across various mediums, and his unique style and approach to art continue to captivate audiences around the world.

Monnar Baldemor is a talented Filipino artist known for his unique style of Surrealist Expressionism. He was born on February 14, 1970, in Paete, Laguna, and pursued his education at the University of the East, where he majored in Advertising. Monnar’s father, Manuel Baldemor, is a renowned artist, but Monnar has chosen to carve out his own niche in the art world.

name: MONTOYA, Manuel
bio: Manuel Montoya was born in Davao City on 1959. He studied at Univeristy of Mindanao majoring in BSED. He took a course in Art Studies at London’s International Correspondence School. He founded the Davao Art Foundation together with George So, Lito Pepito, and Jun Alfon during the 1980’s. His art is heavily influenced by European Impressionism and Japanese Art. He had his big break when he met Tito Sausu in Davao, a classmate of Zalameda at the UST. Sausu had a fine collection of old art books on about the principles of design and philosophies of color theory from there Motoya started his own color theory, searching and combining clear, clean and pure colors.

Sausu had a fine collection of old art books on about the principles of design and philosophies of color theory from there Motoya started his own color theory, searching and combining clear, clean and pure colors.

name: MORADA, Jerry
bio: Jerry Morada (b. 1979, Paete, Laguna) is a Filipino sculptor and painter known for merging traditional craftsmanship with contemporary finishes. A Fine Arts graduate of the University of the Philippines Diliman, he began carving under the guidance of his father, a Paete woodcarver, and has since worked in marble, wood, and even ice, often finishing his sculptures with automotive paint to create a modern yet organic look. His works—ranging from robust animal forms to nostalgic, history-inspired pieces—have earned recognition in major competitions like the GSIS National Art Competition. Morada’s art reflects a deep respect for anatomical form, folk heritage, and the quiet strength of enduring traditions.

name: MORALES, Adrian
bio: Adrian Morales was born on September 6, 1971. He studied Engineering in Notre Dame College. He is a part of Artist Society and was introduced to Cesar Legaspi by his uncle , William Yu. He worked under Inday Cadapan, a Miro Picasso follower, but Adrian’s attraction to Ferdinand Leger , whose works are greatly influenced by Aztec patterns became an inspiration to his present style.
